TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

Articles.Content:
> 
> Hmm, I think I remember saying something like that. Yup, I do. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

No coincidence; I never respond to such baseless and scurrilous allegations except as advised by counsel.

> 
> It seems to do fine, though of course framerate suffers. Fortunately, while very large, all three ships have comparatively few parts. Now, before someone points out that I could just use *Kranefly* to tow everything to Gilly-- *no*. I could probably do it if I had to, but I don't have to. There isn't a "target center of mass" option for a non-asteroid tow load, and I'm really not interested in baiting the Kraken by poking around with the klaw looking for a low thrust angle. If only *Evestation* or the M7 had just one axial port to match up with the nose port on the *Kranefly*...but they don't. Two Gilly intercepts it is ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

With KER that is easy to do, actually: switch off all engines except the relevant ones, put them in the first stage alone so KER has no troubles, and watch the "thrust torque". Then free the pivot, and play "null the number". It's more precise than the navball marker in 'roids!

Rune. Baiting the Kraken indeed ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Kuzzter, could you upload the craft file for your Gliido 7P? My domestically made SSTOs are pitiful at best.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-02T02:03:18Z" title="10/02/2015 02:03  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 2, 2015</time> by Sanic**

Kuzzter Jr had a birthday!

Sweet! Say happy Birthday to him!

The dance continues! Three more pages.

![725H86m.png](http://i.imgur.com/725H86m.png)

![vt1p59c.png](http://i.imgur.com/vt1p59c.png)

![2fN7LI5.png](http://i.imgur.com/2fN7LI5.png)

Even if this latest stupidity does work, we have a LOT of fuel and oxidant to get up to the M7. Don't worry, I won't show all the boring bits ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) According to the clock, *Evestation* should be making it back to Gill orbit shortly, and Mortingale will be in Eve SOI the next day--probably getting a Gilly intercept a week or two after. This will give Jeb time to embarrass himself and Bill in at least a dozen more languages.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-02T17:55:36Z" title="10/02/2015 05:55  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 2, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**

"Random Word Salad"

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) :D

> 
> "Random Word Salad"

I hate to admit, I've sort of done this. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I learned some Spanish in school but have been studying French on my own for the last several years. On our recent vacation it turned out that the concierge of our apartment in Paris was Argentinian. My wife "helpfully" told him I spoke Spanish, so he immediately switched to *castellano...*French being his second-best language, and his English not very good at all. 

Not being very multi-lingual myself, my speaking brain can generally only distinguish between "English" and "not-English". So having just spent a considerable amount of time replacing Spanish with French in the "not-English" file, I found myself unable to fully revert. Quite often I would start a sentence in one language and finish it in another. Somehow it all worked out, though. After a few minutes we had settled on a mix of Spanish, French and English and were communicating well enough for me to understand his detailed instructions for sneaking into the Louvre without paying. But if I had heard a single word of Italian or Mandarin at that moment, I think my *cabeza* would have exploded.

Careful, apparently the claw does not work on things with a SOI, so you will need to balance the ship on the drills(in their extended condition of course).

Just be careful not to break them off...
Random Word Salad is a beautiful language and I won't let anyone talk crap about it!
I haven't what talking of the turkey fried winglet motors if going to the car for the reason of perhaps reasonable sandwich the moat.
And so begins yet another period of rather uneventful small talk until Kuzzter's next post. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
"Random word salad" reminds me of Fawful and his food-related metaphors. Love it!

Just caught up. Loads of fun, as usual.

I loved 'Shh! Don't let the ship hear you!'.

The 'Random Word Salad' was very funny, along with Jeb's remark about being culturally inclusive.

Happy landings!

> Not being very multi-lingual myself, my speaking brain can generally only distinguish between "English" and "not-English". So having just spent a considerable amount of time replacing Spanish with French in the "not-English" file, I found myself unable to fully revert. Quite often I would start a sentence in one language and finish it in another. Somehow it all worked out, though. After a few minutes we had settled on a mix of Spanish, French and English and were communicating well enough for me to understand his detailed instructions for sneaking into the Louvre without paying. But if I had heard a single word of Italian or Mandarin at that moment, I think my *cabeza* would have exploded.

[https://youtu.be/V1xMDn-Btkk?t=26](https://youtu.be/V1xMDn-Btkk?t=26)

> 
> And so begins yet another period of rather uneventful small talk until Kuzzter's next post. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

AHH! The withdrawal!

> 
> AHH! The withdrawal!

Your withdrawal, my grind ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Here's a teaser/spoiler/update to keep you going for now:

![PIPzEAT.png](http://i.imgur.com/PIPzEAT.png)

Yep, I docked EVERYTHING. Missing from the picture is *Alouette*, which was on the *Evestation* port at far right but is now on the surface getting yet another 15 tons of ore. (the light wasn't good enough for a picture when *Alouette* was docked). I played for a while after taking this picture, and after two docks of *Alouette* and one of *Kranefly* there are about 20,000 units (100 tons) of oxidant in the M7. The OX is the rate-limiting step, as *Kranefly* can carry a huge amount of LF from the surface but only about 9 tons of OX plus 15 tons of ore. *Mortingale* is in Eve orbit and will be at Gilly in five days, by which time I think the M7 will be full.

It's actually surprisingly fun for me to grind this out rather than just "take it as read" and hyperedit to full tanks. Shuttling the two oreships, docking and undocking, even the Gilly landings... I've become an expert at abusing low gravity for personal gain, I think. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
SO, is that SSTO from Gilly? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Landing on Gilly is more like rendezvous than landing.

Kuzzter's posts are like crack ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-05T02:40:18Z" title="10/05/2015 02:40  AM" data-short="8 yr">October 5, 2015</time> by astrokerb**

Hope everyone had a good weekend--we all saw the Martian, and thoroughly loved it! Here's four new pages of fine grinding...

![LbR20qL.png](http://i.imgur.com/LbR20qL.png)

![VMemNvf.png](http://i.imgur.com/VMemNvf.png)

![TuRByK7.png](http://i.imgur.com/TuRByK7.png)

![VL4SKuP.png](http://i.imgur.com/VL4SKuP.png)

I think we've seen enough docking and mining for now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) There's enough fuel in orbit to begin rescue ops, so we'll be moving the action to Eve very soon!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> SO, is that SSTO from Gilly? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

You could fling a ham sandwich from Gilly and it'd make orbit, so yeah ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Landing on Gilly is more like rendezvous than landing.

Am starting to take shortcuts, like thrusting straight at it and re-orbiting wrongway. The extra fuel I spend is nothing compared to the amount coming from the surface.

> 
> Kuzzter's posts are like crack ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Happy to oblige ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> What have Bob and Tedus been doing for the last year?

Oh I dunno... sleeping, playing Fizzbin, giving each other haircuts... making purple sandcastles... trying to figure out how to connect a k-pad so they can read 'Plan Kappa'... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-10-05T14:27:08Z" title="10/05/2015 02:27  PM" data-short="8 yr">October 5, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**
Hooray! Monday is a little brighter now!

Excellent!

I actually laughed out loud once again. This time it was Dilsby's line 'Please, no... I don't do well in interludes.' That was beautiful.

Loved the song as well, of course.

I can't believe you were grinding out all that ore 15 tonnes at a time. You deserve a persistence award. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Thanks Kuzzter.

Happy landings!

> 
> You could fling a ham sandwich from Gilly and it'd make orbit, so yeah ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If it's low fat, you could probably swing it into escape velocity.

BTW, the whole update is hilarious, but it was the first line of the song that made my day1 ;-)

> 
> I can't believe you were grinding out all that ore 15 tonnes at a time. You deserve a persistence award. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Well it's not quite that bad--I can take up 15,000 units of LF (75 tons) in the Kranefly each time, so the ore is pretty much all going to make OX. Starting next trip I'm going to dock *Alouette* to the *Kranefly's* nose--that means I can move 30 tons of ore, plus make another 10+ tons of OX on the surface and store it in the various rocket fuel tanks. (since I'll be doing the whole trip on *Kranefly's* LVN engines I will no longer need oxidant to power *Alouette*) So should be only 2-3 more trips from this point, including the additional OX and LF required to fill up *Mortingale*. Figured I'd just explain that here rather than show it, as I really do not want to do another mining page ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
